book_title: I'm a Caterpillar (Hello Reader! Science. Level 1)
Summary:
Provides a simple explanation of what happens as a caterpillar changes
into a butterfly--from the caterpillar's point of view.

Three charming stories of Poppleton and his wonderful friends who
spend a day with him at the beach and give him sound advice when he
needs it most.

Poppleton goes to a movie alone, makes a quilt with his friends, and
ends up eating a banana split instead of taking a bath. The Poppleton
books are an excellent way to help children learn to read.

Poppleton the pig plants a dogwood tree, gets a cold, and tries to
hang wallpaper with the not very helpful aid of his friends.

Poppleton the pig goes stargazing, tries out a new bed before he buys
it, and goes sailing for the first time.

Recalling how the kids made fun of him last year, Charlie is reluctant
to participate in this year's Kwanzaa Festival at school, until he
remembers the deeper meaning of Kwanzaa.

book_title: Angels Don't Know Karate (Adventures of the Bailey School Kids, 23)
Summary:
Miss Angela Michaels, the new karate teacher in Bailey City, who is
also the school crossing guard, is so kind and generous that Melody
becomes convinced that she is a guardian angel. Original.

book_title: Dragons Don't Cook Pizza (Adventures of the Bailey School Kids, 24)
Summary:
Visiting the new Jewel's Pizza Castle, the kids from Mrs.
Jeeper's class begin to suspect that a fire-breathing dragon is
doing the cooking.

book_title: Mermaids Don't Run Track (Adventures of the Bailey School Kids (Paperback))
Summary:
The Bailey School Kids set out to uncover the secrets of their
beautiful, singing track coach, who bears a striking resemblance to a
mermaid whom the children have seen in a picture. Original.

book_title: The Great Race (Hello Reader! (DO NOT USE, please choose level and binding))
Summary: The animals on the farm want to have a race. Who will win?

book_title: The Day the Sheep Showed Up (Hello Reader!, Level 2)
Summary:
In a humorous easy reader, barnyard animals discover how they are
alike and how they are different from a new animal on the farm.
Original.

book_title: Bruce Coville's Book of Aliens II: More Tales to Warp Your Mind
Summary:
A collection of tales filled with fearsome and friendly aliens
includes the stories of a boy whose life is permanently changed, an
alien-summoning pay phone, and a band of breakfast aliens.

book_title: Bruce Coville's Book of Ghosts: More Tales to Haunt You (Bruce Coville's Book of Ghosts , No 2)
Summary:
A boy's ghost takes over the body of a professional ball player, a
librarian does some ghostbusting, and a sloppy boy is haunted by a
ghost pig

book_title: Bruce Coville's Book of Nightmares II: More Tales to Make You Scream (Bruce Coville's Book of Nightmares , No 2)
Summary:
Tells the stories of a kid who fears the number 5, a boy who falls
apart after his parents' divorce, and some kids who wish it would
snow forever

book_title: Bruce Coville's Book of Spine Tinglers II: More Tales to Make You Shiver (Coville Anthologies)
Summary:
This collection of short stories includes tales from Bruce Coville and
a variety of authors.

book_title: Bruce Coville's Book of Magic II: More Tales to Cast a Spell on You
Summary:
Tells the stories of a pair of magic dancing shoes, a boy and his dad
who become custodians of a unicorn, and a family that tampers with the
unknown

Wild things happen at the South Middle School when Milo's science
project, Henrietta the chicken, becomes the hockey team's mascot
and their only chance for a winning season.

book_title: The Case of the Fun House Mystery (The Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, 3)
Summary:
When an evil monster preys upon the fun house at the Tons of Fun
amusement park, turning the special effects noises into scary monster
noises, employees Madame Zelda, Ferris Wheel Fred, and Carousel Cal
hire the Trenchcoat Twins. Original.

book_title: The Case of the Sea World Adventure (The Adventures of Mary Kate and Ashley)
Summary:
Super-duper pint-sized snoopers Mary-Kate and Ashley pursue a second
mystery aboard a vacation cruise ship when their father's top-
secret computer disk, which contains a dolphin communicator program,
is stolen. Original.

book_title: The Case of the Mystery Cruise (The Adventures of Mary Kate and Ashley, No 2)
Summary:
While on an ocean cruise with their family, Mary-Kate and Ashley try
to discover who stole their father's top-secret computer disk.

book_title: A Wizard's Dozen: Stories of the Fantastic
Summary:
Twelve stories place everyday kids in all kinds of magical trouble
that pits them against everything from dragons and wizards to fairies
and giants, in a collection that includes contributions by Patricia
Wrede and Jane Yolen. Reprint. SLJ.

When a shortcut trail between Pam's backyard to Anna and
Lulu's pony paddock is blocked by a neighbor's new sheep pen,
the girls fear that Pam will be left out of future Pony Pal
excursions. Original.

book_title: The Girl Who Hated Ponies (Pony Pals No. 13)
Summary:
Visiting the Pony Pals for the weekend, Melissa Prince claims to hate
ponies and seems to care about nothing except her hair and clothes,
until a surprise snowstorm and pony makeover party brings about
unexpected changes.

The Pony Pals are faced with the challenge of helping a friend deal
with her pony going blind. They each learn a lesson about taking care
of a pony and the importance of telling the truth.

book_title: The Case of the Mystery Ghost (Clue Jr.)
Summary:
In this set of short, illustrated mysteries, members of the Clue Club
take young sleuths on lots of fun adventures.

book_title: The Case of the Karate Chop (Clue Jr.)
Summary:
Eight short, illustrated mysteries include the Case of the Different
Fish at the pet store, the Case of the Extra Clue at a treasure hunt,
and a mystery at the local school yard. Original.

Thirteen-year-old Rilla's life becomes chaotic when someone
anonymously enrolls her in the Monster of the Month Club and little
living monsters start to arrive in the mail.
A young boy guides the reader through his garden.

The survivors of the Titanic shipwreck struggle to get on with their
lives after the pain and sadness of that disastrous night.

book_title: The Littles and Their Amazing New Friend (Littles)
Summary:
On a hill above the Big Valley, the Littles make a discovery that
changes their world--tiny people are living in the forest up there!

The best-selling author of ANIMORPHS and EVERWORLD presents a fresh,
exciting, and gritty science-fiction series that combines a little
2001, a little Armageddon, and a whole lot of action!

When a group of friends travels to the Everworld, their perceptions of
everything around them is altered and distorted in this fantastical
tale for young adults. Original. 325,000 first printing.

In the fourth installment of a spine-tingling series that has seen
April, Jalil, David, and Christopher take on Vikings, trolls, Aztecs,
and dragons, the group is about to discover the true opposite of
heaven. Original.

Christopher and his companions manage to escape from Fairy Land only
to land in Olympus, the section of Everworld where the ancient Greek
gods live, which is about to become the latest target of the insect-
like forces of Ka Anor, the god ...

Jalil, David, Christopher, and April must defend themselves against a
group of transplanted aliens whose aim is to combine textbook
information with their own technology to devise new and frightening
weapons.

Senna, the girl whom David, Christopher, April, and Jalil followed
into the Everworld, offers her own account of growing up among humans
and of her search for her mother in an Egypt ruled by Amazon warriors.

While returning to Mount Olympus to help the gods against Ka Anor,
David and his friends fall afoul of mighty Neptune, and discover more
than they would like about the lost city of Atlantis.

The kids end up in Eire, which is populated with giants, leprechauns,
and the inevitable gods.

book_title: Playing With Fire (Hear No Evil , No 6)
Summary:
Rescuing a little boy from a house fire, Sara becomes an overnight
hero and the target of an arsonist, who is angered that Sara's
actions have taken the attention away from him. Original.

Follows a group of eighty people chosen to board a revamped space
shuttle set to leave Earth before an astroid destroys it and
everything on it, but no one knows if their plan will work, or where
they will end up even if it does.

book_title: You're Invited to Mary-Kate and Ashley's Sleepover Party (Mary-Kate & Ashley Olsen Series)
Summary:
Fearing that their sleepover party will be ruined if the reluctant
Brighton leaves, Mary-Kate and Ashley prepare music, games, scary
stories, and party favors to encourage Brighton to stay overnight.

book_title: The Case of the U. S. Space Camp Mission (The Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, No 4)
Summary:
While visiting the U.S. Space Camp, Mary-Kate and Ashley search for
clues that will explain why the space shuttle was covered with
hundreds of mysterious holes.

book_title: The Case of the Christmas Caper: A Novelization (Adventures of Mary-Kate and Ashley, No 5)
Summary:
When the "Spirit," a special airplane filled with gifts,
goes missing from ELF Airlines on Christmas Eve, Trenchcoat Twins
Mary-Kate and Ashley seek out a villain who would spoil the season for
kids all over the world. Original.

book_title: The Case of the Hotel Who-Done-It: A Novelization (Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, No 7)
Summary:
In Hawaii on vacation, the girls chase down the thief who stole their
mother.

book_title: The Case of the Volcano Mystery: A Novelization (Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, No 8)
Summary:
Exploring the Mexican jungle, Mary-Kate and Ashley meet three miners
who think they are being chased by a monster, and seeking to disprove
the monster's existence, the twins discover strange, snow-covered
footprints. Original.

book_title: There's a Tarantula in My Homework (Little Apple)
Summary:
After Micah's class adopts a tarantula as the new class pet, a
mysterious chain of vanishing treats keeps everyone guessing, until
the hungry culprit is finally discovered. Original.

book_title: There's a Frog in My Sleeping Bag
Summary:
When a trickster begins playing pranks on the third-grade class at
Camp Buffalo, Janna becomes determined to find out who it is before
another frog shows up in her sleeping bag. Original.

When the world ended, eighty people were given the chance for
survival.

A stranded group of humans on a strange planet begin to war against
one another after a strange series of discoveries.

book_title: The Magic School Bus: Hello Out There : A Sticker Book About the Solar System
Summary:
The reader can use stickers to decorate the Magic School Bus, as Ms.
Frizzle's class travels in space.

Jobs, 2Face, Mo'Steel and the others discover that the ship they
are now living on is trying to destroy them through beautiful,
horrifying, and dangerous images, and the only way the Remnants can
stay alive is by working together.

While exploring, Mo' Steel and Billy Weir meet Kubric DiSalvo,
whose skin has been replaced with a transparent plastic covering by
the ship, and meanwhile Yago and Jobs find themselves caught in a
computer-generated sea battle.

Escaping earth's destruction by an asteroid, the Remnants find
themselves captive on a ship controlled by a computer called Mother
who wants them to battle it's enemies, but who is the real enemy?

As the three Remnants factions attempt to gain control of Mother, the
computer that runs the ship they depend on for survival, their battle
propels them to a shocking realization, and to the discovery of new
enemies.

Convinced that he has discovered part of Earth, Jobs tries to persuade
Billy and the others to alter the ship's course and thus break the
Big Compromise.

The Remnants want to stop the constant fighting, but their dreams of
peace are shattered by a horrifying new weapon held by the Blue
Meanies, meanwhile, Jobs is troubled by the existence of an unknown
stranger walking among them.

After a devastating asteroid hits the planet Earth, and after the
Remnants have been asleep for five hundred years, they wish to revisit
their home, but a compromise with the aliens needs to be broken in
order for this to happen.

The earth has been destroyed by an asteroid, but the Remnants are back
after 500 years, trying to survive the new harsh environment despite a
lack of food and water, terrible storms, enemies at their feet, and
dreams plaguing their minds.

The author describes the circumstances in Germany after Hitler came to
power that led to the evacuation of many Jewish children to England
and her experiences as a young girl in England during World War II.

book_title: The Music of Dolphins (Apple Signature Edition)
Summary:
After rescuing an adolescent girl from the sea, researchers learn she
has been raised by dolphins and attempt to rehabilitate her to the
human world.

Photographs and text present an up-close look at varied aspects of the
lives of professional basketball players, from pre-game preparations,
practice, game action, signing autographs, and more.

Bat 6an annual softball game between two rivalrous teams of sixthgrade
girlsexplodes catastrophically in 1948 because of the prejudice
surrounding two new girls who are "different." Reprint.

book_title: Schmoe White and the Seven Dorfs (Happily Ever Laughter)
Summary:
A retelling of the classic Snow White fairy tale, with Schmoe White
joining the rock group called the Seven Dorfs

Trapped in an extraordinary world after starting, but failing to
complete, the mysterious game "Jumanji," a young boy is
discovered twenty-five years later by two children who share in his
remarkable adventures.

book_title: The Vanishing Vampire (The Accidental Monsters , No 1)
Summary:
Sebastian is turned into a vampire when he walks home from the movies
one night.

book_title: Memories of Anne Frank: Reflections of a Childhood Friend
Summary:
Recounts the story of Hannah Goslar, a close friend of Anne Frank and
one of the last to see her alive.

book_title: Triplet Trouble and the Cookie Contest (Triplet Trouble)
Summary:
When the Tucker Triplets start to brag about who can make the best
cookies, Sam knows that big trouble is on the way and becomes involved
in a mess-making, cookie-baking contest that Mr. Parker says is
missing a key ingredient. Original.

book_title: Triplet Trouble and the Pizza Party (Triplet Trouble)
Summary:
When Mr. Parker promises his second-grade class that they will win a
pizza party if they behave themselves, Sam fears that the
irrepressible Tucker triplets will spoil everything, especially when
Alex Tucker decides to throw her own party.

book_title: Triplet Trouble and the Class Trip (Triplet Trouble)
Summary:
Worried that their class trip to the museum will be boring, Alex
Tucker leads fellow triplets Ashley and Adam away from the group for
their own private tour.

book_title: Triplet Trouble and the Bicycle Race (Triplet Trouble)
Summary:
Mr. Parker's second-grade class is very excited about an upcoming
bike race, and while the Tucker triplets feel certain of winning,
their harrassed classmates remain skeptical.

In this novel based on the story of Cinderella, Ella struggles against
the childhood curse that forces her to obey any order given to her.

Five ghost stories blend spookiness and humor by taking young readers
into the worlds of quirky ghosts and complementing each tale with
funny twists. Original.
A collection of five easy-to-read stories about creepy creatures.

book_title: The Magic School Bus Out of This World: A Book About Space Rocks (Magic School Bus)
Summary:
When Walker Elementary is threatened by a hurtling space rock, Ms.
Frizzle and her students launch a field trip into outer space aboard a
transformed Magic School Bus space ship, where they learn about
asteroids, comets, and more.

book_title: The Magic School Bus Ups and Downs: A Book About Floating and Sinking (Magic School Bus)
Summary: Reveals why things float or sink

Emily Elizabeth tells about Clifford's first Valentine's Day
when he was still a tiny puppy. Clifford goes to the post office with
Emily Elizabeth to mail valentines and gets lost in the carts full of
letters.

book_title: Help!: I'm Trapped in the President's Body
Summary:
When the President of the United States visits Jake Sherman's
school, a crazy body-switching machine goes off by mistake. Look out
America--Jake's in charge!

book_title: Help! I'm Trapped in My Sister's Body (Help! I'm Trapped (Paperback))
Summary:
Jake Sherman has led his online pen pal into falsely believing that he
is a star athlete, but now that his pen pal is coming to visit he must
switch bodies with someone who is good in sports--his sister.

book_title: The Magic School Bus Spins a Web: A Book About Spiders (Magic School Bus)
Summary:
The Magic School Bus turns into a giant spider and Ms. Frizzle's
class learns all about spiders and how they use their webs to trap
their prey.

book_title: The Magic School Bus Shows and Tells: A Book About Archaeology (Magic School Bus)
Summary:
Ms. Frizzle and the gang travel back in time to the origins of an
artifact and learn what it's like to be an archaeologist.

Pinocchio, a mischievous wooden puppet with a talent for getting into
and out of trouble, wants to be a real boy more than anything else in
the world.

When Kristy reluctantly takes part in a hazing prank for her softball
team, she worries that her little stepsister, Karen, will find out the
truth and think badly of her.

book_title: So Far From Home : The Diary of Mary Driscoll, an Irish Mill Girl, Lowell, Massachusetts, 1847 (Dear America)
Summary:
In the diary account of her journey from Ireland in 1847 and of her
work in a mill in Lowell, Massachusetts, fourteen-year-old Mary
reveals a great longing for her family.

book_title: The Complete Guide to the Baby-Sitters Club (Baby-Sitters Club Portrait Collection)
Summary:
A guide to the popular series contains a map of Stoneybrook, along
with eight sections of facts about the club, the club's members,
and the families of Stoneybrook.

book_title: We Love the Dirt (Hello Reader. Level 1)
Summary:
The people, animals, and objects on the farm explain their
relationship with the dirt, which is used and needed by all.

Thirteen-year-old Phoebe recalls her neat younger brother Mick and his
death in a bicycle accident.

Twelve-year-old Max has unleashed the power of Kazaam, a rapping genie
who lives in a boom box and grants Max three wishes. Children's
book based on the amazing new film starring Shaquille O'Neal.

Kazaam, a rapping genie who lives inside a boom box, grants twelve-
year-old Max three wishes Just when twelve-year-old Max could use some
serious help in his life, along comes Kazaam!

book_title: Goosebumps Monster Edition 2:  Night of the Living Dummy, Night of the Living Dummy II, and Night of the Living Dummy III
Summary:
Discovering an old ventriloquist dummy in the trash and naming it
Slappy, young Lindy inadvertently sets off a terrifying series of
events, in a scary story collection that features cover art of Slappy
with flashing eyes.

book_title: Please Don't Feed the Vampire! (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 15)
Summary:
You are invited to choose from over 20 spooky endings. You buy
something called "Vampire in a can" and at first you think
it's just a goofy vampire costume, but then you notice a packet in
the bottom of the can labeled: DANGER--KEEP AWAY!

book_title: Little Comic Shop of Horrors (Give Yourself Goosebumps, Book 17)
Summary:
The characters from the comic books in Milo's Comics Dungeon lurk
around every corner as readers choose from more than twenty endings to
a creepy story.

book_title: Attack of the Beastly Baby-Sitter (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 18)
Summary:
Readers are placed in the character of a young person who is being
watched by terrifying babysitter Zoe, whose ideas of fun including
horrifying games like the Bottomless Ball Pit and Tomb of the Unknown
Rat. Original.

book_title: Escape from Camp Run-for-Your-Life (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 19)
Summary:
In a story with more than twenty possible endings, readers are placed
in the character of a young person who is attending a sports camp that
is run by alien invaders. Original.

book_title: Toy Terror: Batteries Included (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 20)
Summary:
Readers are placed in the character of a contest winner who must
decide between two toy prizes, including Nasty Kathy the talking doll
and a robot called the Annihilator 3000. Original.

book_title: The Twisted Tale of Tiki Island (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 21)
Summary:
Readers are placed in the character of a vacationer at South Pacific
Island's fright fest, where a gang of ancient Tiki warriors and a
crew of pirate skeletons are the least of the scary natives. Original.

Twelve-year-old Newton and his classmate Vanessa, who is obsessed with
butterflies and flying, undergo significant changes as they try to
discover why the emerald rainbow butterflies return to Angel Falls
every spring. Reprint.

Tells the story of Miriam, a young girl being raised by her widowed
father in ancient Israel, who grows up to be Mary Magdalene.
Side-splitting spooky riddles, jokes, and puns tickle your funny bone.

Entering his grape juice-spurting macaroni dinosaur in the Crestview
Elementary Art Contest, certain of winning the prize, Spencer is
horrified when his two-year-old brother makes a snack out of his
entry.

When someone begins making a mess out of Spencer's trash, Spencer
believes that a Garbage Snooper, a creature something like a werewolf,
is responsible, and he assigns the job to Stinkman, a superhero who is
not afraid to get dirty.

book_title: Let Go of That Toe (Spencer's Adventures , No 6)
Summary:
Spencer's pet turtle act turns the school talent show into chaos
when the toe-nibbling turtle starts a dance craze no one in his school
will ever forget, in an early chapter book for developing readers.
Original.
A fill in book to remember one's summer vacation.

book_title: Be Careful What You Wish for (Goosebumps Presents TV Book #8)
Summary:
Samantha Byrd's wish to be the strongest basketball player turns
out differently than she expected.

When Ethan Krantz's unusual science experiment ends up being added
to the lunch special in the cafeteria, a hideous new creature forms.

Accidentally spilling Humongasaurus Dinosaur growth hormone on a sack
of potatoes, Arnold and Max are shocked when the spuds sprout all over
the subway system, invade the baseball stadium, and attempt to destroy
the city. Original.

book_title: One Hungry Cat (Hello Reader! Math Level 3 (Paperback))
Summary:
Tom the Cat uses division and his hungry stomach to figure out how
many delicious baked treats each of his afternoon guests will get on
their plates, if he can resist temptation. Original.

Missing their wilderness roots when their mother moves them to a busy
suburb, Shana and Cody convince their mother that they can handle the
responsibilities of staying in a woodland cabin unsupervised, with
troublesome results. Reprint.

book_title: Tornadoes Can Make It Rain Crabs: Weird Facts About the World's Worst Disasters : A Weird-But-True Book (Strange World)
Summary:
Shares unusual facts and jokes about hurricanes, lightning, blizzards,
floods, dust storms, and volcanoes.

Sailing to America on board the Titanic, young Albert faces grown-up
decisions about life and death when the magnificent ship is struck by
an iceberg and begins to sink. Reprint.

book_title: The Berenstain Bear Scouts and the Sinister Smoke Ring (Berenstain Bear Scouts (Paperback))
Summary:
When Brother begins hanging out with the Too Tall Gang, they draw him
into their ring of stealing, lying, cheating, and especially smoking,
and the Bear Scouts and Gramps help Brother resist the habit.
Original.

book_title: The Berenstain Bear Scouts and the Magic Crystal Caper (Berenstain Bear Scouts (Paperback))
Summary:
Visiting Grizzly Gran and Gramps to ask an important question, the
Bear Scouts are alarmed when Gran's magic crystal ball falls off
the table and goes prediction wild, tempting the crooked swindler,
Ralph Ripoff.

book_title: The Berenstain Bear Scouts and the Run-Amuck Robot (The Berenstain Bear Scouts)
Summary:
The Bear Scouts team up to help track down Robow, a supercharged robot
on the loose who is running wild and turning Bear Country into Scare
Country. Original.

book_title: The Berenstain Bear Scouts and the Really Big Disaster (Berenstain Bear Scouts (Paperback))
Summary:
Bigpaw, the biggest bear in Bear Country, wants a job but appears
unemployable, until an earthquake shakes up Beartown and Bigpaw puts
his muscle to work to save the town. Original.

book_title: The Berenstain Bear Scouts and the Evil Eye (Berenstain Bear Scouts)
Summary:
The evil Weasel McGreed tries to do away with the pesky Bear Scouts by
hypnotizing Bigpaw into thinking the scouts are mosquitoes. Original.

book_title: Scholastic's El Autobus Magico Ve Las Estrellas: UN Libro Sobre Rocas Espaciales (Mariposa, Scholastic En Espanol)
Summary:
On a trip to outer space, Ms. Fizzle and the gang learn all about
shooting stars, meteorites, and other space rocks. Full color.

Getting his pals Daffy Duck, Sylvester, Tweety, and Wile E. Coyote
into a terrible fix, Bugs Bunny begs super athlete Michael Jordan to
help them win a critical game against a crew of space creatures.
Original. Movie tie-in.

book_title: Amber Brown Wants Extra Credit (Amber Brown (Paperback))
Summary:
Getting fed up when her room falls into shambles, her homework is
late, and her mother begins to date someone, a frustrated Amber Brown
wishes that someone would give her a little credit.

Amber's life has changed dramatically--her parents are divorced,
her father lives in France, her best friend has moved to another
state, and now her mother must decide whether to remarry.

Amber tries to deal with escalating telephone fights between her
divorced parents .

book_title: In the Time of Dinosaurs (Animorphs Megamorphs, 2)
Summary:
The young animorphs discover that they can transform themselves into
any animal, even the extinct dinosaurs.

book_title: The Meanest Thing to Say (A Little Bill Book for Beginning Readers)
Summary:
When a new boy in his second grade class tries to get the other
students to play a game that involves saying the meanest things
possible to one another, Little Bill shows him a better way to make
friends.

book_title: The Treasure Hunt (A Little Bill Book for Beginning Readers)
Summary:
Little Bill finds that everyone has something special they can do
except for him, but when Great-Grandma Alice pays a visit, he sees
that he may just have a special talent of his very own! Original.

book_title: Shipwreck Saturday (A Little Bill Book for Beginning Readers)
Summary:
Although his brother's friends make fun of it, Little Bill is very
proud of the toy boat he has built and very upset when it is wrecked
the first time he puts it in the water.

book_title: The Best Easter Egg Hunt Ever (Read With Me Paperbacks)
Summary:
Young readers are invited to join in the fun at an Easter egg hunt, in
scenes that include hidden Easter objects and picture clues

At home alone with the chicken pox, young Alex must outwit four
mobsters who are after the secret microchip he found, and he thwarts
them with a series of amazing booby traps.

book_title: In the Woods : Who's Been There?
Summary:
A boy and girl in the autumn woods find an empty nest, a cocoon,
gnawed bark, and other signs of unseen animals and their activities.

Thirteen short stories, by such authors as Nancy Varian Berberick,
Gregory Maguire, and Margaret Bechard, about unicorns in both mythical
and contemporary settings.

book_title: If You Lived 100 Years Ago (If You Lived....)
Summary:
Shows what it would have been like to live in New York City during the
1890's.

Computer-literate, twelve-year-old Tru keeps an electronic diary where
she documents her desire to cure her developmentally delayed twin
brother and her plan to create her own television show. Reprint.

book_title: Mummies Tombs and Treasure Secrets of An
Summary: Text and photographs examine the mummies and tombs of ancient Egypt.

book_title: Voyage on the Great Titanic: The Diary of Margaret Ann Brady (Dear America)
Summary:
In her diary in 1912, thirteen-year-old Margaret Ann describes how she
leaves her lonely life in a London orphanage to become a companion to
a wealthy American woman, sails on the Titanic, and experiences its
sinking.

Start the school year laughing. Get back in the swing of things with
back-to-school jokes and riddles that will keep you giggling all
school year long.

book_title: Afternoon on the Amazon (Magic Tree House, # 6)
Summary: Copy 2.

Follows the growth and maturation of the sunflowers Gordon the farmer
plants in one of his fields.

Hannah resents the traditions of her Jewish heritage until time travel
places her in the middle of a small Jewish village in Nazi-occupied
Poland.

"A super-creative collection of kid-pleasing activities that
build essential math skills and celebrate favorite themes from
September to June"--Cover.

Entries include pronunciations, simple definitions, sentences, and
plurals and other forms of the words.

After she falls headfirst into a bird's nest, a baby bat is raised
like a bird until she is reunited with her mother.

When Matt and his sister arrive at their grandmother's for
Thanksgiving, strange things begin to happen involving a giant turkey
with fangs and their grandmother's mysterious handyman.

Seeing a strange glow hovering over Harley Hills, Nick and his twin
sister Jessie are shocked when the adults of their hometown begin
talking like robots and eating strange foods. Original.

In this final battle between Aliens and humans, Nick, Jessie, and
Frasier attempt to defeat the brain stealers and prevent the earth
from falling under their domination.

book_title: The Girl Who Chased Away Sorrow: The Diary of Sarah Nita, a Navajo Girl, New Mexico, 1864 (Dear America)
Summary:
The diary of Sarah Nita, a thirteen-year old Navajo girl, which
describes the Navajos' forced 400-mile walk from their ancestral
homeland to Fort Sumner in 1864.

Ten short fantasy tales by the author of Dealing with Dragons include

filmmaking, including how a set is built, how stunts are performed,
how special effects are achieved, and how films are edited.

Traces the development of railways from the first Babylonian rutways
to the electromagnetic, driverless trains of today and describes how
trains are built and operated.

A colorful storybook with die-cut pages follows the antics of a fuzzy
little bunny. By the author of The Fuzzytail Friends' Egg Hunt,
Nighty-Night, Little One, and Puppy Peek-a-Boo.

When a disagreeable man with two boys marries a widow with three
children, family adjustments are complicated by two magic chemistry
sets which cause strange things to happen around the house.

Meet Ace, Babe's great-grandson, who also gets a new cover from
Knopf Paperbacks this season. " A Horn Book Fanfare Honor Book An
IRA/CBC Children's Choice A School Library Journal Best Book of
the Year.

book_title: Why Pick On Me? (Marvin Redpost 2, paper)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Unfairly accused of being a nose-picker by the class bully, Marvin
Redpost is shunned by his classmates, until he can prove his
innocence. Simultaneous.

book_title: Alone In His Teacher's House (Marvin Redpost 4, paper)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Marvin discovers that he had bitten off more than he can chew when he
is asked by his teacher to dog-sit for a week. Simultaneous.

book_title: Diesel's Devious Deed and Other Thomas the Tank Engine Stories (Please Read to Me)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Diesel causes no end of trouble among the engines when he arrives at
Thomas the Tank Engine's train yard.

book_title: A Cow on the Line and Other Thomas the Tank Engine Stories (Please Read to Me)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Sir Topham Hatt's railroad engines discover that respect for the
rules and for each other pays off in the end.

An illustrated collection of primarily traditional or anonymous
verses.

book_title: The Black Stallion and the Girl (The Black Stallion Series)
Summary:
Alec Ramsay has a hard time persuading his partners to retain the girl
he hires as a trainer and an even harder time convincing them to let
her race the Black Stallion when Alec is suspended as a jockey.
Reissue.
A collection of hands-on nature experiments, activities, and crafts.

book_title: Six by Seuss: A Treasury of Dr. Seuss Classics
Little Bert's Book of Numbers (Sesame Street Toddler Books)
Summary:
Introduces the numbers one through ten as Little Bert counts his
favorite things.

book_title: The Little Mermaid (Step into Reading, Step 4)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
A little sea princess, longing to be human, trades her mermaid's
tail for legs, hoping to win the love of a prince and earn an immortal
soul for herself.

book_title: Choo-Choo, Peek-A-Boo: A Thomas the Tank Engine Peek-A-Board Book (Peek-a-Board Books)
Summary:
Die cut holes allow children to help Sir Topham Hatt find his
grandchildren who are hiding in the railroad station

book_title: Sweet Clara and the Freedom Quilt
Summary:
A young slave stitches a quilt with a map pattern which guides her to
freedom in the North.

book_title: The Care Bears and the Big Clean-Up
Summary:
When Lisa and Simon move to the country and discover that litter is
ruining the woods, they join forces with the Care Bears to motivate
the community into organizing the Big Clean-up.

Along with her family, thirteen-year-old Mai embarks on a treacherous
journey from war-ravaged Vietnam to the United States in order to seek
freedom. Reprint.

publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
A little girl helps break the spell on her toy nutcracker and watches
him change into a handsome prince.

While on a school field trip, May and Evan find themselves transported
back in time and made slaves by one of the warring Indian tribes who
lived in the Arizona desert long ago.

They find dinosaurs and volcanoes and adventure. Veteran storyteller
Osborne builds the power of reading into the story: it's the books
in the tree house that give the kids the magic to travel and see far,
far away."--Booklist.

book_title: Knight At Dawn (Magic Tree House 2, paper)
Summary:
Eight-year-old Jack and his younger sister Annie find a magic
treehouse. Each book in the collection takes them to different places.

publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Includes easy recipes, instructions for making decorations and favors,
and simple activities for all kinds of tea parties.

book_title: Backup Goalie (Angel Park Soccer Stars, No. 5)
Summary:
When Nate Matheson, Angel Park's regular goalie, gets injured he
has to train Jared Trajillo to replace him.

book_title: Junie B. Jones and the  Stupid Smelly Bus (Junie B. Jones 1, paper)
Summary:
In her own words, a young girl describes her feelings about starting
kindergarten and what she does when she decides not to ride the bus
home.

A beautiful Maine summer turns deadly for Sarah, Tim, and Jenny
Hoskins and their neighbors as they discover the horrifying truth
about the strange new owners of Spool Island.

book_title: Comeback! Four True Stories (Step Into Reading Books, a Step Into Sports Step 4 Book/Grades 2-4)
Summary:
Describes how four famous athletes overcame serious injuries or
debilitating conditions to become superstars.

book_title: The Tiger in the Well (Sally Lockhart Trilogy, Book 3)
Summary:
Sally's comfortable life with her daughter is shattered when a
strange man arrives, claiming to be Sally's husband and
Harriet's father, an event that forces mother and child to go into
hiding in the dangerous slums of London's East End.

publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
A free-wheeling toad takes his friend Cat and other animal friends on
a spirited driving adventure, always observing safe practices.

book_title: The Black Stallion Mystery (Black Stallion Series)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary: Someone's set a treacherous trap for Alec and his horse...

book_title: Peter and the Lost Boys (Hook Mini Storybook)
Summary:
When a grown-up Peter Pan returns to Neverland to rescue his children,
the Lost Boys can scarcely believe he is their old leader.

Introduces a variety of armored animals and describes how they defend
themselves with built-in spines, spikes, scales, shells, and other
types of outer coverings.

Introduces animal disguises involving camouflage and mimicry, in such
animals as the zebra, polar bear, and caterpillar.

Introduces the physical characteristics and habits of birds of prey,
including falcons, eagles, vultures, owls, and hawks.

book_title: The Berenstain Bears and the Trouble with Grownups (First Time Books)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
The squabbling in the Bear household between parents and cubs subsides
after Mama and Papa Bear and Brother and Sister Bear perform humorous
role-playing skits.

book_title: Barry: The Bravest Saint Bernard (Step-Into-Reading, Step 5)
Summary:
Relates the feats of Barry, the Saint Bernard dog whose name, to this
day, honors the best dog at the Saint Bernard Monastery.

publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
During a fun-filled trip to the zoo, toddlers are introduced to a wide
variety of wild animals who live there. For children under three.

book_title: Tales from the Crypt: Introduced by the Old Witch
Summary:
A collection of horror stories, featuring such grisly characters as a
vampire, werewolf, and murderous madman.

book_title: Jokes from the Crypt: Told by the Vault-Keeper, the Old Witch, and the Crypt-Keeper
Summary:
A collection of jokes featuring vampires, werewolves, and other grisly
characters.

book_title: We're Different, We're the Same (Sesame Street Picturebacks)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Illustrations and simple rhyming text show that while the body parts
of various human and Muppet characters may look different, they have
similar uses.

book_title: Trek of Doom (The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles, TV-5)
Summary:
In 1916, in German East Africa, seventeen-year-old Indiana Jones joins
an expedition from the Belgian Congo, a mission that soon becomes
hampered by illness, ambush, desertion, and mutiny. Original.

book_title: Revolution! (The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles, TV-6)
Summary:
Caught in the middle of the Russian Revolution in Petrograd in July
1917, Indiana Jones tries to keep his student friends out of trouble
without betraying his involvement with French military intelligence.

book_title: The Mystery of the Talking Skull (Three Investigators, No 11)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
An old trunk involves the three investigators with dangerous criminals
seeking a cache of stolen money.

book_title: P. J. Funnybunny Camps Out (Step-Into-Reading, Step 2)
publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Although P.J. and his friends refuse to let Donna and Honey Bunny go
camping with them because "camping is not for girls, " the
girls follow and get proof that camping is hard work even for boys.

publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Elmo builds a dollhouse out of cardboard boxes with the help of his
friends

Leona discovers the ups and downs of friendship with her new neighbor
Ike.

publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers
Summary:
Juniper, a young Cornish princess, draws on the healing arts and white
magic she learned from her godmother to protect her kingdom and her
family from the machinations of her power-hungry aunt, an evil black
witch. Reprint. SLJ.
